title: The Photography of Crisis - The Photo Essays of Weimar Germany
description:
The Photography of Crisis - The Photo Essays of Weimar Germany
Eng | 2012 | 0271054220 | 200 Pag | PDF | 79 MB

The fifteen years in Germany between the end of World War I and the National Socialistsâ€™ rise to power in 1933 stand out as one of the twentieth centuryâ€™s most tumultuous periods. These years of political and economic upheaval famously spawned significant and lasting changes in the arts. However, one noteworthy product of Weimar Germanyâ€™s booming cultural life has escaped significant critical attention: the photo essay. The Photography of Crisis examines narrative photography and creates a snapshot of where Germany was after World War I and what it would become with the rise of National Socialism. By reading Weimar photo essays within their historical and literary context, Daniel Magilow shows how German photographers intervened in modernityâ€™s key political and philosophical debates regarding the changing notions of nature, culture, personal identity, and national identity
